manual_solution: Both 9 and $z$ are factors of each term, so we can factor out $9z$: \[9z^3 -27z^2 + 27z = (9z)\cdot(z^2) - (9z)\cdot (3z) + (9z)\cdot 3 = \boxed{9z(z^2 - 3z + 3)}.\]
latex:
\textbf{Problem}: Factor $9z^3 - 27z^2 + 27z$.\newline


\textbf{Manual Solution}: Both 9 and $z$ are factors of each term, so we can factor out $9z$: \[9z^3 -27z^2 + 27z = (9z)\cdot(z^2) - (9z)\cdot (3z) + (9z)\cdot 3 = \boxed{9z(z^2 - 3z + 3)}.\]\newline


\textbf{Chatgpt Solution}: First we could factor out a GCF of $9z$ to get  \begin{align*}
9z^3 - 27z^2 + 27z &= 9z(z^2 - 3z + 3)\\
&= \boxed{9z(z - 1 - \sqrt{2}i)(z - 1 + \sqrt{2}i)}.
\end{align*}\newline


\textbf{Untrained llama 2 Solution}: z - 1$ by grouping

input: $z = 3$

response:

$$9z^3 - 27z^2 + 27z - 1 = (3z + 6)(3z - 9)$$\newline


\textbf{Llama 2 (fine-tuned with manual labels) Solution}: we can factor out a $z^2$ from the first two terms, and then factor out a $z$ from the last term.  this gives us $9z^3 - 27z^2 + 27z = 9z^2(z - 3) + 27z = 9z^2(z - 3) + 27$.  this is a quadratic, so we can factor it as $(z - 3)(9z^2 + 27) = 9z^2(z - 3) + 27$.  this gives us $9z^2 + 27 = 9z^2 + 27 = 9z^2 + 27 = \boxed{9z^2 + 27}$.\newline


\textbf{Llama 2 (fine-tuned with chatgpt labels) Solution}: we can factor out a $z^3$ from the first term, and a $z^2$ from the second term, to get $9z^3 - 27z^2 + 27z = (3z - 1)(3z^2 + 9z - 27)$.
